ETYMOLOGY: From Old English tǣcere, from tǣcan 'to teach' + -ere 'agent suffix'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person whose job is to teach students, especially in a school or college.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 以教育学生为职业的人，尤其是在学校或大学。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: My history teacher made the subject very interesting.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我的历史老师把这个科目讲得非常有趣。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Something that serves to teach or provide a lesson.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 能够教导或提供教训的事物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Experience is a harsh but effective teacher.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 经验是一位严厉但有效的老师。
